Hey @TIMMLOPK I appreciate your contribution, however, is not necessary to dynamically import the `code-demo` component due to we are already showing it just when is visible in the viewport `line:49`?

> Hey @TIMMLOPK I appreciate your contribution, however, is not necessary to dynamically import the `code-demo` component due to we are already showing it just when is visible in the viewport `line:49`?

Hey,I had noticed [home](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/tree/main/apps/docs/src/components/home) custom section still use dynamic import code demo

Hey, @TIMMLOPK looks like I forgot to remove it only in `custom-themes.tsx` https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/blob/main/apps/docs/src/components/home/custom-themes.tsx, would you like to send a new PR removing it? 🙌🏻

> Hey, @TIMMLOPK looks like I forgot to remove it only in `custom-themes.tsx` https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/blob/main/apps/docs/src/components/home/custom-themes.tsx, would you like to send a new PR removing it? 🙌🏻

I am pleased to open new PR

nodes.title: v1.0.7-beta.5
nodes.bodyText:
[react]/[checkbox]
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context

fix(react-avatar):  Avatar first child margin:0 removed
refactor(react-checkbox): The Checkbox component functionality was migrated to @react-aria/checkbox in order to provide better state management and accessibility
refactor(react-link): Link transitions performance improved
refactor(react-card): Card transitions performance improved
refactor(react-table): Table checkboxes improved
refactor(docs-checkbox): Checkbox group docs separated from checkbox docs
refactor(docs-checkbox): Events/Props/Accessibility separated on docs for checkbox and checkbox group
feat(repo): stale sets up




Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: feat(react-checkbox): useCheckbox from react-aria implemented for a single checkbox

Merge pull request #388 from nextui-org/fix/avatar-container-margin

Fix/avatar container margin
Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into refactor/checkbox-migration-to-react-aria
fix(react-checkbox): checkbox native input hidden by styles
refactor(react): card and link specific transitions applied

Merge pull request #390 from nextui-org/refactor/checkbox-migration-to-react-aria

Refactor/checkbox migration to react aria

@@ -0,0 +1,30 @@
+# Number of days of inactivity before an issue becomes stale
+daysUntilStale: 7
+# Number of days of inactivity before a stale issue is closed
+daysUntilClose: 3
+# Issues with these labels will never be considered stale
+exemptLabels:
+  - pinned
+  - 📌 pin
+  - security
+  - accessibility
+  - performance
+  - documentation
+  - good first issue
+  - "help wanted"
+  - "help wanted: high priority"
+  - "help wanted: urgent"
+  - "feature request"
+# Label to use when marking an issue as stale
+staleLabel: 'type: stale'
+# Comment to post when marking an issue as stale. Set to `false` to disable
+markComment: >
+  Hello 👋, to help manage issues we automatically close stale issues.
+  This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had activity for quite some time.
+  Has this issue been fixed, or does it still require the community's attention?
+  > This issue will be closed in 10 days if no further activity occurs.
+  Thank you for your contributions.
+# Comment to post when closing a stale issue. Set to `false` to disable
+closeComment: >
+  Closing this issue after a prolonged period of inactivity. If this is still present in the latest release, please feel free to create a new issue with up-to-date information.
+only: issues
\ No newline at end of file

@@ -0,0 +1,41 @@
+const App = `import React from 'react'
+import { Checkbox, Grid } from "@nextui-org/react";
+
+export default function App() {
+  const [selected, setSelected] = React.useState(['buenos-aires', 'sydney']);
+
+  return (
+    <Grid.Container gap={2}>
+      <Grid>
+        <Checkbox.Group
+          label="Select cities (uncontrolled)"
+          defaultValue={['buenos-aires', 'auckland']}
+        >
+          <Checkbox value="buenos-aires">Buenos Aires</Checkbox>
+          <Checkbox value="auckland">Auckland</Checkbox>
+          <Checkbox value="sydney">Sydney</Checkbox>
+        </Checkbox.Group>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Checkbox.Group
+          label="Select cities (controlled)"
+          color="secondary"
+          value={selected}
+          onChange={setSelected}
+        >
+          <Checkbox value="buenos-aires">Buenos Aires</Checkbox>
+          <Checkbox value="auckland">Auckland</Checkbox>
+          <Checkbox value="sydney">Sydney</Checkbox>
+        </Checkbox.Group>
+      </Grid>
+    </Grid.Container>
+  );
+}`;
+
+const react = {
+  '/App.js': App
+};
+
+export default {
+  ...react
+};

@@ -0,0 +1,133 @@ +--- +title: 'Checkbox Group' +description: 'A CheckboxGroup allows users to select one or more items from a list of choices.' +url: https://nextui.org/docs/components/checkbox-group +--- + +# Checkbox Group + +A CheckboxGroup allows users to select one or more items from a list of choices. CheckboxGrup implementation is based on +@react-aria/checkbox + +```jsx +import { Checkbox } from '@nextui-org/react'; +``` + + + + + + + + + +> Note: See React's documentation on [uncontrolled components](https://reactjs.org/docs/uncontrolled-components.html) for more info. + + + +> Accessibility: If a visible label isn't specified for a `Checkbox.Group`, an aria-label must be provided for accessibility. If the field is labeled by a separate element, an aria-labelledby prop must be provided using the id of the labeling element instead. Checkbox elements within a group should always have a visible label. + + + +### APIs + + + +#### Checkbox Group Props + +| Attribute | Type | Description | Default | +| ---------------- | ------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------ | --------- | +| **children\*** | [CheckboxGroupChildren](#checkbox-group-children) | The Checkboxes contained within the checkbox group. | - | +| **label** | `ReactNode` | The content to display as the label. | - | +| **value** | `string[]` | The current value (controlled). | - | +| **defaultValue** | `string[]` | The current value (uncontrolled). | - | +| **name** | `string` | The name of the checkbox group, used when submitting an HTML form. | - | +| **row** | `boolean` | Whether the checkbox group is horizontal | `false` | +| **size** | [NormalSizes](#normal-sizes) | The size of the component | `medium` | +| **color** | [NormalColors](#normal-colors) | The color of the component | `default` | +| **labelColor** | [SimpleColors](#simple-colors) | The color of the label | `default` | +| **disabled** | `boolean` | Whether the checkbox group is disabled | `false` | +| **readOnly** | `boolean` | Whether the input can be selected but not changed by the user. | `false` | +| **css** | `Stitches.CSS` | Override Default CSS style | - | +| **as** | `keyof JSX.IntrinsicElements` | Changes which tag component outputs | `div` | +| ... | `HTMLDivAttributes` | Native element props | - | + + + +#### Checkbox Group Events + +| Attribute | Type | Description | Default | +| ------------ | -------------------- | --------------------------------------------- | ------- | +| **onChange** | `(value: T) => void` | Handler that is called when the value changes | - | + + + +#### Checkbox Group Accessibility Props + +| Attribute | Type | Description | Default | +| --------------------- | -------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------- | +| **id** | `string` | The element's unique identifier. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/id) | - | +| **aria-label** | `string` | Defines a string value that labels the current element | - | +| **aria-labelledby** | `string` | Identifies the element (or elements) that labels the current element | - | +| **aria-describedby** | `string` | Identifies the element (or elements) that describes the object. | - | +| **aria-details** | `string` | Identifies the element (or elements) that provide a detailed, extended description for the object. | - | +| **aria-errormessage** | `string` | Identifies the element that provides an error message for the object. | - | + + + +### Checkbox Group types + + + +#### Checkbox Group Children + +```ts +type ReactElement | ReactElement[] +``` + +#### Normal Colors + +```ts +type NormalColors = + | 'default' + | 'primary' + | 'secondary' + | 'success' + | 'warning' + | 'error' + | 'gradient'; +``` + +#### Simple Colors + +```ts +type SimpleColors = + | 'default' + | 'primary' + | 'secondary' + | 'success' + | 'warning' + | 'error'; +``` + +#### Normal Sizes + +```ts +type NormalSizes = 'xs' | 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg' | 'xl'; +```

@@ -1,12 +1,13 @@ --- title: 'Checkbox' -description: 'Checkboxes allow the user to select one or more items from a set of options.' +description: 'Checkboxes allow users to select multiple items from a list of individual items, or to mark one individual item as selected.' url: https://nextui.org/docs/components/checkbox --- # Checkbox -the `Checkbox` component allow the user to select one or more items from a set of options. +Checkboxes allow users to select multiple items from a list of individual items, or to mark one individual item as selected. Checkbox implementation is based on +@react-aria/checkbox ```jsx import { Checkbox } from '@nextui-org/react'; @@ -18,7 +19,7 @@ import { Checkbox } from '@nextui-org/react'; @@ -54,7 +55,7 @@ import { Checkbox } from '@nextui-org/react'; @@ -65,21 +66,17 @@ import { Checkbox } from '@nextui-org/react'; /> - +> Note: See React's documentation on [uncontrolled components](https://reactjs.org/docs/uncontrolled-components.html) for more info. @@ -90,42 +87,56 @@ import { Checkbox } from '@nextui-org/react'; #### Checkbox Props -| Attribute | Type | Accepted values | Description | Default | -| ------------------ | ----------------------------- | ------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------- | -| **value** | `string` | - | Unique identification value (only in group) | - | -| **label** | `string` | - | Checkbox label | - | -| **color** | `NormalColors` | [NormalColors](#normal-colors) | Change checkbox color | `default` | -| **labelColor** | `SimpleColors` | [SimpleColors](#simple-colors) | Change checkbox label color | `default` | -| **size** | `NormalSizes` | [NormalSizes](#normal-sizes) | Checkbox size | `md` | -| **checked** | `boolean` | `true/false` | Determine the value of the checkbox | `false` | -| **initialChecked** | `boolean` | `true/false` | Determine the initial value of the checkbox | `false` | -| **animated** | `boolean` | `true/false` | Display checkbox animations | `true` | -| **disabled** | `boolean` | `true/false` | Disable checkbox | `false` | -| **indeterminate** | `boolean` | `true/false` | Indeterminate checkbox | `false` | -| **preventDefault** | `boolean` | `true/false` | Prevent default event on when is selected through the `Space, Enter` keys | `true` | -| **rounded** | `boolean` | `true/false` | Rounded checkbox | `false` | -| **line** | `boolean` | `true/false` | Line in the middle of the label when the `Checkbox` is checked | - | -| **onChange** | `CheckboxEvent` | - | The callback invoked when the checked state of the `Checkbox` changes. | - | -| **css** | `Stitches.CSS` | - | Override Default CSS style | - | -| **as** | `keyof JSX.IntrinsicElements` | - | Changes which tag component outputs | `label` | -| ... | `LabelHTMLAttributes` | `'form', 'className', ...` | Native checkbox props | - | +| Attribute | Type | Description | Default | +| ------------------ | ------------------------------ | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------- | +| **children** | `ReactNode` | The label for the element | - | +| **value** | `string` | The value of the input element, used when submitting an HTML form. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#htmlattrdefvalue) | - | +| **label** | `string` | The label for the element | - | +| **name** | `string` | The name of the input element, used when submitting an HTML form. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#htmlattrdefname) | - | +| **color** | [NormalColors](#normal-colors) | The color of the component | `default` | +| **labelColor** | [SimpleColors](#simple-colors) | The color of the label | `default` | +| **size** | [NormalSizes](#normal-sizes) | The size of the component | `md` | +| **checked** | `boolean` | Whether the element should be checked (controlled) | `false` | +| **initialChecked** | `boolean` | Whether the element should be checked (uncontrolled) | `false` | +| **animated** | `boolean` | Whether the checkbox has animations | `true` | +| **disabled** | `boolean` | Whether the input is disabled | `false` | +| **indeterminate** | `boolean` | Indeterminism is presentational only. The indeterminate visual representation remains regardless of user interaction. | `false` | +| **rounded** | `boolean` | Whether the checkbox is rounded | `false` | +| **line** | `boolean` | Line in the middle of the label when the `Checkbox` is checked | - | +| **readOnly** | `boolean` | Whether the input can be selected but not changed by the user. | `false` | +| **required** | `boolean` | Whether user input is required on the input before form submission. | `false` | +| **autoFocus** | `boolean` | Whether the element should receive focus on render | +| **css** | `Stitches.CSS` | Override Default CSS style | - | +| **as** | `keyof JSX.IntrinsicElements` | Changes which tag component outputs | `label` | +| ... | `HTMLLabelElement` | Native element props | - | - + -#### Checkbox Group Props - -| Attribute | Type | Accepted values | Description | Default | -| -------------- | ----------------------------- | ------------------------------ | ----------------------------------- | --------- | -| **value** | `string[]` | - | List of checked checkbox | `[]` | -| **row** | `boolean` | `true/false` | Change the checkbox group direction | `false` | -| **size** | `NormalSizes` | [NormalSizes](#normal-sizes) | Size of all checkboxes in the group | `medium` | -| **color** | `NormalColors` | [NormalColors](#normal-colors) | Change checkbox group color | `default` | -| **labelColor** | `SimpleColors` | [SimpleColors](#simple-colors) | Change checkbox group label color | `default` | -| **disabled** | `boolean` | `true/false` | Disable checkbox group | `false` | -| **onChange** | `(values: string[]) => void` | - | Checkbox group event handler | - | -| **css** | `Stitches.CSS` | - | Override Default CSS style | - | -| **as** | `keyof JSX.IntrinsicElements` | - | Changes which tag component outputs | `div` | -| ... | `HTMLAttributes` | `'id', 'className', ...` | Native props | - | +#### Checkbox Events + +| Attribute | Type | Description | Default | +| ----------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | +| **onChange** | `(checked: boolean) => void` | Handler that is called when the element's selection state changes | - nodes.title: Refactor/checkbox migration to react aria
nodes.bodyText:
[react]/[checkbox]
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context

The Checkbox component functionality was migrated to @react-aria/checkbox in order to provide better state management and accessibility
Link transitions performance improved
Card transitions performance improved
Table checkboxes improved
Checkbox group docs separated from checkbox docs
Events/Props/Accessibility separated on docs for checkbox and checkbox group




Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: feat(react-checkbox): useCheckbox from react-aria implemented for a single checkbox
Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into refactor/checkbox-migration-to-react-aria
fix(react-checkbox): checkbox native input hidden by styles
refactor(react): card and link specific transitions applied

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -0,0 +1,41 @@
+const App = `import React from 'react'
+import { Checkbox, Grid } from "@nextui-org/react";
+
+export default function App() {
+  const [selected, setSelected] = React.useState(['buenos-aires', 'sydney']);
+
+  return (
+    <Grid.Container gap={2}>
+      <Grid>
+        <Checkbox.Group
+          label="Select cities (uncontrolled)"
+          defaultValue={['buenos-aires', 'auckland']}
+        >
+          <Checkbox value="buenos-aires">Buenos Aires</Checkbox>
+          <Checkbox value="auckland">Auckland</Checkbox>
+          <Checkbox value="sydney">Sydney</Checkbox>
+        </Checkbox.Group>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Checkbox.Group
+          label="Select cities (controlled)"
+          color="secondary"
+          value={selected}
+          onChange={setSelected}
+        >
+          <Checkbox value="buenos-aires">Buenos Aires</Checkbox>
+          <Checkbox value="auckland">Auckland</Checkbox>
+          <Checkbox value="sydney">Sydney</Checkbox>
+        </Checkbox.Group>
+      </Grid>
+    </Grid.Container>
+  );
+}`;
+
+const react = {
+  '/App.js': App
+};
+
+export default {
+  ...react
+};

@@ -0,0 +1,133 @@ +--- +title: 'Checkbox Group' +description: 'A CheckboxGroup allows users to select one or more items from a list of choices.' +url: https://nextui.org/docs/components/checkbox-group +--- + +# Checkbox Group + +A CheckboxGroup allows users to select one or more items from a list of choices. CheckboxGrup implementation is based on +@react-aria/checkbox + +```jsx +import { Checkbox } from '@nextui-org/react'; +``` + + + + + + + + + +> Note: See React's documentation on [uncontrolled components](https://reactjs.org/docs/uncontrolled-components.html) for more info. + + + +> Accessibility: If a visible label isn't specified for a `Checkbox.Group`, an aria-label must be provided for accessibility. If the field is labeled by a separate element, an aria-labelledby prop must be provided using the id of the labeling element instead. Checkbox elements within a group should always have a visible label. + + + +### APIs + + + +#### Checkbox Group Props + +| Attribute | Type | Description | Default | +| ---------------- | ------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------ | --------- | +| **children\*** | [CheckboxGroupChildren](#checkbox-group-children) | The Checkboxes contained within the checkbox group. | - | +| **label** | `ReactNode` | The content to display as the label. | - | +| **value** | `string[]` | The current value (controlled). | - | +| **defaultValue** | `string[]` | The current value (uncontrolled). | - | +| **name** | `string` | The name of the checkbox group, used when submitting an HTML form. | - | +| **row** | `boolean` | Whether the checkbox group is horizontal | `false` | +| **size** | [NormalSizes](#normal-sizes) | The size of the component | `medium` | +| **color** | [NormalColors](#normal-colors) | The color of the component | `default` | +| **labelColor** | [SimpleColors](#simple-colors) | The color of the label | `default` | +| **disabled** | `boolean` | Whether the checkbox group is disabled | `false` | +| **readOnly** | `boolean` | Whether the input can be selected but not changed by the user. | `false` | +| **css** | `Stitches.CSS` | Override Default CSS style | - | +| **as** | `keyof JSX.IntrinsicElements` | Changes which tag component outputs | `div` | +| ... | `HTMLDivAttributes` | Native element props | - | + + + +#### Checkbox Group Events + +| Attribute | Type | Description | Default | +| ------------ | -------------------- | --------------------------------------------- | ------- | +| **onChange** | `(value: T) => void` | Handler that is called when the value changes | - | + + + +#### Checkbox Group Accessibility Props + +| Attribute | Type | Description | Default | +| --------------------- | -------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------- | +| **id** | `string` | The element's unique identifier. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/id) | - | +| **aria-label** | `string` | Defines a string value that labels the current element | - | +| **aria-labelledby** | `string` | Identifies the element (or elements) that labels the current element | - | +| **aria-describedby** | `string` | Identifies the element (or elements) that describes the object. | - | +| **aria-details** | `string` | Identifies the element (or elements) that provide a detailed, extended description for the object. | - | +| **aria-errormessage** | `string` | Identifies the element that provides an error message for the object. | - | + + + +### Checkbox Group types + + + +#### Checkbox Group Children + +```ts +type ReactElement | ReactElement[] +``` + +#### Normal Colors + +```ts +type NormalColors = + | 'default' + | 'primary' + | 'secondary' + | 'success' + | 'warning' + | 'error' + | 'gradient'; +``` + +#### Simple Colors + +```ts +type SimpleColors = + | 'default' + | 'primary' + | 'secondary' + | 'success' + | 'warning' + | 'error'; +``` + +#### Normal Sizes + +```ts +type NormalSizes = 'xs' | 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg' | 'xl'; +```

nodes.title: Fix/avatar container margin
nodes.bodyText:
[react]/[avatar]
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context

The Avatar container was setting margin:0 to the first-child
Animation performance improved




Screenshots - Animations

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -48,7 +48,7 @@ import { Button } from '@nextui-org/react';
 
 <Playground
   title="Loading"
-  desc="You can add a `Loading` children to the `Button` and disable interactions by using the `clickable={false}` property."
+  desc="You can add a `Loading` child element to the `Button` and disable the interactions using the 'disabled' property."
   files={buttonContent.loading}
 />

nodes.title: v1.0.6-beta.5
nodes.bodyText:
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context

refactor(react-button): Button component has been migrated to @react-aria/button providing better accessibility and event handling.
-fix(react-modal): Modal open animation behaviour, the same opacity animation was added to BackdropContent as the Modal
-fix(react-pagination): noMargin and !rounded collision styles avoided
-fix(react-button): required prop added




Screenshots - Animations

commit.message:
Merge pull request #376 from nextui-org/fix#369/modal-css-error

Fix#369/modal css error
reafactor[react](button): migrated to react-aria, work in progress, tests missing
fix: add appearance-in animation for backdrop content
feat(react-button): warning onClick avoided, disabled styled improved, clickable prop removed

Merge pull request #377 from TianenPang/fix/modal-animation-behavior

Fix #288 modal animation behavior
Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into refactor/button-migration-to-react-aria

Merge pull request #382 from richtone/fix/InputRequiredParameter

Input {required} parameter fix (again)
Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into next
Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into refactor/button-migration-to-react-aria

Merge pull request #384 from nextui-org/refactor/button-migration-to-react-aria

Refactor/button migration to react aria
Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into next

Merge pull request #383 from nextui-org/fix/no-margin-pagination

Fix/no margin pagination
Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into next

nodes.title: Refactor/button migration to react aria
nodes.bodyText:
[react]/[button]
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context

Button component has been migrated to @react-aria/button providing better accessibility and event handling.




Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: reafactor[react](button): migrated to react-aria, work in progress, tests missing
feat(react-button): warning onClick avoided, disabled styled improved, clickable prop removed
Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into refactor/button-migration-to-react-aria
Merge branch 'next' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into refactor/button-migration-to-react-aria

nodes.title: v1.0.5-beta.5
nodes.bodyText:
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context

fixreact: Button Disabled State Changes properly corresponding to Variant Set and it also fixes the issue with disabled Button Group issue when it's called with variant plus typo fix #319
refactorreact: Button transitions performance improved #319
feareact: Upgrade @stitches/react to 1.2.7
refactor(react)[theme]: Missing keys were added to the ConfigType.Theme interface
fixreact: Progress default colour typo
refactorreact: Drip and useDrip exposed
fixreact: gradient ghost/bordered button with single icon #320




Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: Disabled State Now Adapts Property to Button Variant
Fixed typo on newly added Table Docs
refactor(button): disabled styles applied by a function due to is quite difficult to do it by compound variants without applying the important tag

Merge pull request #367 from nextui-org/pr/365

Button Disabled state now adaptive to Button Variant Set Plus Fix a typo on Table Doc

Merge pull request #372 from nextui-org/refactor/drip-exports

chore[react](root): drip exported
Merge branch 'main' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into next
fix[react](button): gradient ghost/bordered button with single icon padding/margin

nodes.title: fix[react](button): gradient ghost/bordered button with single icon p…
nodes.bodyText:
[react]/[button]
TASK:  #320
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context
Button styles were refactored to handle bordered/ghost variants when has only icons



Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: fix[react](button): gradient ghost/bordered button with single icon padding/margin

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -3,7 +3,6 @@ import { Meta } from '@storybook/react';
 import Button from './index';
 import { Spacer, Grid, Loading } from '../index';
 import { Lock, Notification, User, Camera, Activity } from '../utils/icons';
-import useTheme from '../use-theme';
 
 export default {
   title: 'General/Button',
@@ -92,6 +91,35 @@ export const Colors = () => (
   </>
 );
 
+export const Ghost = () => (
+  <>
+    <Button color="primary" ghost>
+      Primary
+    </Button>
+    <Spacer y={0.5} />
+    <Button color="secondary" ghost>
+      Secondary
+    </Button>
+    <Spacer y={0.5} />
+    <Button color="success" ghost>
+      Success
+    </Button>
+    <Spacer y={0.5} />
+    <Button color="warning" ghost>
+      Warning
+    </Button>
+    <Spacer y={0.5} />
+    <Button color="error" ghost>

nodes.title: Button Disabled state now adaptive to Button Variant Set Plus Fix a typo on Table Doc
nodes.bodyText:
[react]/[button]
TASK: This PR Fixes #319
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context

Button Disabled State Changes properly corresponding to Variant Set and it also fixes the issue with disabled Button Group issue when it's called with variant plus typo fix
Button transitions performance improved

Screenshots - Animations
TYPO:-

New Changes:-

commit.message: Disabled State Now Adapts Property to Button Variant
Fixed typo on newly added Table Docs
refactor(button): disabled styles applied by a function due to is quite difficult to do it by compound variants without applying the important tag

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -167,7 +167,7 @@ import { Table } from '@nextui-org/react';
 | **lineWeight**                    | [NormalWeights](#normal-weights)                                     | Header border weight for `headerLined` table                                                                                                                                                   | `normal`  |
 | **borderWeight**                  | [NormalWeights](#normal-weights)                                     | Table border weight for `bordered` table                                                                                                                                                       | `normal`  |
 | **hideLoading**                   | `boolean`                                                            | Hide loading component on infinity pagination                                                                                                                                                  | `false`   |
-| **animated**                      | `boolean`                                                            | Display animated checboxes, rows and sortable columns                                                                                                                                          | `true`    |
+| **animated**                      | `boolean`                                                            | Display animated checkboxes, rows and sortable columns                                                                                                                                          | `true`    |
 | **selectionMode**                 | [SelectionMode](#selection-mode)                                     | The type of selection that is allowed in the collection.                                                                                                                                       | `none`    |
 | **selectionBehavior**             | [SelectionBehavior](#selection-behavior)                             | How multiple selection should behave in the collection. Go to the [@react-aria/table](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-aria/useTable.html#selection-behavior) docs for more information. | `toggle`  |
 | **allowDuplicateSelectionEvents** | `boolean`                                                            | Whether `onSelectionChange` should fire even if the new set of keys is the same as the last.                                                                                                   | -         |

   <>
     <Button.Group color="success">
       <Button>One</Button>

       <Button>Three</Button>
     </Button.Group>
-    <Button.Group color="error" rounded>
+    <Button.Group color="gradient">
       <Button>One</Button>
-      <Button>Two</Button>
+      <Button disabled>Two</Button>
       <Button>Three</Button>
     </Button.Group>

-      <Button>Action1</Button>
+    <Button.Group color="error">
+      <Button>One</Button>
+      <Button>Two</Button>
+      <Button disabled>Three</Button>
+    </Button.Group>

+      <Button disabled>Action1</Button>
+      <Button>Action2</Button>
+      <Button>Action3</Button>
+    </Button.Group>
+    <Button.Group color="gradient" bordered>
+      <Button disabled>Action1</Button>
       <Button>Action2</Button>
+      <Button>Action3</Button>
     </Button.Group>

       <Button>Action1</Button>
+      <Button disabled>Action2</Button>
       <Button>Action2</Button>
     </Button.Group>
     <Button.Group color="secondary" size="sm">
-      <Button>One</Button>

       <Button>Two</Button>
       <Button>Three</Button>

-      <Button>Two</Button>
+      <Button disabled>Two</Button>
+      <Button>Three</Button>

+    <Button.Group color="gradient" ghost>

+      <Button>Three</Button>

nodes.title: v1.0.4-beta.5
nodes.bodyText:
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context
Core

fix(theme-provider): SSR provider wrap warning
fix(table): cssContainer prop warning
fix: animated prop warning
fix(table): hideHeader prop warning

Docs

fix(sandpack): code viewer editor theme is now working
refactor(home): home sections are now being loaded just when are visible this change makes a huge performance improvement
feature(home): nprogress library added to show a progress bar on top of the page when the user navigates through routes




Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: fix[react](table): animated and hideHeader props destructured

Merge pull request #360 from nextui-org/fix/table-animated-prop

fix[react](table): animated and hideHeader props destructured

Merge pull request #355 from nextui-org/fix_326/ssr-provider-wrap

fix[react](root): @react-aria/ssr package version changed to 3.1.2
fix[react](table): containerCss destructured to avoid warning
feat[docs]: perfomance improvements, sandpack editor fixed

+import { globalCss } from '@nextui-org/react';
+
+export default globalCss({
+  // home sections
+  '.inview-section': {
+    zIndex: '$2',
+    width: '100%'
+  },
+  // sandpack-react
+  '.sp-highlight': {
+    background: '$codeHighlight'
+  },
+  '.sp-tabs': {
+    border: 'none !important',
+    borderRadius: 'inherit',
+    button: {
+      cursor: 'pointer'
+    }
+  },
+  '.sp-layout': {
+    border: 'none !important',
+    overflow: 'visible !important',
+    WebkitMaskImage: 'none !important',
+    background: 'transparent !important'
+  },
+  '.sp-pre-placeholder': {
+    background: 'transparent !important',
+    borderRadius: '0 !important'
+  },
+  '#nprogress': {
+    pointerEvents: 'none'
+  },
+  '#nprogress .bar': {
+    background: 'var(--nextui-colors-secondary)',
+    position: 'fixed',
+    zIndex: '999999',
+    top: 0,
+    left: 0,
+    width: '100%',
+    height: '3px'
+  },
+  /* Fancy blur effect */
+  ' #nprogress .peg': {
+    display: 'block',
+    position: 'absolute',
+    right: '0px',
+    width: '100px',
+    height: '100%',
+    boxShadow:
+      '0 0 10px var(--nextui-colors-secondary), 0 0 5px var(--nextui-colors-secondary)',
+    opacity: 1,
+    WebkitTransform: 'rotate(3deg) translate(0px, -4px)',
+    transform: 'rotate(3deg) translate(0px, -4px)'
+  }
+});

TASK:

 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

animated and hideHeader props were destructured to avoid the not allowed prop warning

nodes.title: v1.0.3-beta.5
nodes.bodyText:
Closing #341
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context

New component: Table
New documentation editor
User and Image components documented
Documentation content improved
Bug fixes




Screenshots - Animations

commit.message:
Revert "Merge branch 'main' into next"

This reverts commit f35b5f58eb846f4ceee1a97dc60ff4ad88518d80, reversing
changes made to 3780a237fdb23c2196d47e2dc4a1f1073954d8f9.
fix[docs](editor): workaround applied to fix production styles mismatches on Sandpack editor

+const App = `import { Avatar, Grid } from "@nextui-org/react";
+
+export default function App() {
+  return (
+    <Grid.Container gap={2}>
+      <Grid>
+        <Avatar
+          size="lg"
+          src="https://i.pravatar.cc/150?u=a042581f4e29026024d"
+          color="primary"
+          bordered
+        />
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Avatar
+          size="lg"
+          src="https://i.pravatar.cc/150?u=a042581f4e29026704d"
+          color="secondary"
+          bordered
+        />
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Avatar
+          size="lg"
+          src="https://i.pravatar.cc/150?u=a04258114e29026702d"
+          color="success"
+          bordered
+        />
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Avatar
+          size="lg"
+          src="https://i.pravatar.cc/150?u=a048581f4e29026701d"
+          color="warning"
+          bordered

+  ];

+    <Grid.Container gap={1}>
+      <Grid xs={12}>
+        <Avatar.Group count={12}>

+    </Grid.Container>
+  );
+}`;

+const UserIcon = `import { React } from '@nextui-org/react';\n

+export const UserIcon = ({

+  filled,
+  size,
+  height,
+  width,
+  label,
+  ...props
+}) => {
+  return (
+    <svg
+      data-name="Iconly/Curved/Profile"
+      xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
+      viewBox="0 0 24 24"
+      width={size || width || 24}
+      height={size || height || 24}
+      {...props}
+    >
+      <g
+        fill="none"
+        stroke={fill}
+        strokeLinecap="round"
+        strokeLinejoin="round"
+        strokeMiterlimit={10}
+        strokeWidth={1.5}
+      >
+        <path
+          data-name="Stroke 1"
+          d="M11.845 21.662C8.153 21.662 5 21.088 5 18.787s3.133-4.425 6.845-4.425c3.692 0 6.845 2.1 6.845 4.4s-3.134 2.9-6.845 2.9z"

+        />
+      </g>
+    </svg>

+
+const AppJs = `import { Button,Spacer } from '@nextui-org/react';

+import { UserIcon } from './UserIcon';
+
+export default function App() {
+  return (

+        icon={<HeartIcon fill="currentColor" filled />}
+      />
+      <Spacer y={1} />
+      <Button iconRight={<CameraIcon fill="currentColor" />}>

+  );
+}`;

+  '/App.js': AppJs
+};
+
+export default {
+  ...react
+};

+const App = `import { Button, Grid, Loading } from "@nextui-org/react";
+
+export default function App() {
+  return (
+    <Grid.Container gap={2}>
+      <Grid>
+        <Button auto clickable={false} color="primary" css={{ px: "$13" }}>
+          <Loading color="white" size="sm" />
+        </Button>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Button auto clickable={false} color="secondary" css={{ px: "$13" }}>
+          <Loading type="spinner" color="white" size="sm" />
+        </Button>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Button auto clickable={false} color="success" css={{ px: "$13" }}>
+          <Loading type="points" color="white" size="sm" />
+        </Button>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Button auto clickable={false} color="warning" css={{ px: "$13" }}>
+          <Loading type="points-opacity" color="white" size="sm" />
+        </Button>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Button auto clickable={false} color="error" css={{ px: "$13" }}>
+          <Loading type="spinner" color="white" size="sm" />
+        </Button>
+      </Grid>
+    </Grid.Container>
+  );
+}`;
+
+const react = {
+  '/App.js': App
+};
+
+export default {
+  ...react
+};

nodes.title: v1.0.2-beta.5
nodes.bodyText:
Closing #341
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context

New component: Table
New documentation editor
User and Image components documented
Documentation content improved
Bug fixes




Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: feat(table): API improved, new types added
Merge branch 'staging' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into feat/table
Merge branch 'main' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into feat/table
Merge branch 'main' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into feat/table
feat(table): table base components in progress base on react-aria/table components
feat[react](table): missing reat-aria/table components created and adapted
fix(docs): Change the default of Button type props
feat[react](table): lined and headerLined variants added
feat: Add type to defaultProps of Button component
chore: Change the default of type props in the Button component docs to 'button'
fix(table-ssr); react aria packages updated in order to fix table ssr issue
fix(table-ssr); react aria packages updated in order to fix table ssr issue
fix(checkbox): checkbox animated styles collision solved
fix(storybook): version updated in order to use webpack5 and prevent table issues
chore(table): new table examples added to storybook
feat[react](table): bordered and sticked table added
feat(table): sticked prop implemented, dynamic table implemented
feat[react](table): table context added in order to managed separated props
chore[react](table): nextui classname added to all table components
chore[react](table): animated prop added to table context
feat[react](table): pagination logic implemented, styles improved
fix[react](pagination): perf issues, dynamic variable stored as a css var
fix[react](pagination): classname added to highlight pagination
refactor[react](pagination): transform animation on active added
feat[react](table): pagination props passed, color taken from table selected color
chore[react](table): disabled row logic removed, waiting for react-aria team
Merge branch 'main' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into feat/table
fix[react](table): div cannot be a child of a table component
fix[react](table): spacer moved to the head to avoid styles misunderstanding

+          data-name="Stroke 3"
+          d="M11.837 11.174a4.372 4.372 0 10-.031 0z"
+        />
+      </g>
+    </svg>
+  );
+}`;
+
+const AppJs = `import { Button,Spacer } from '@nextui-org/react';
+import { HeartIcon } from './HeartIcon';
+import { CameraIcon } from './CameraIcon';
+import { LockIcon } from './LockIcon';
+import { NotificationIcon } from './NotificationIcon';
+import { UserIcon } from './UserIcon';
+
+export default function App() {
+  return (
+    <>
+      <Button
+        auto
+        color="error"
+        icon={<HeartIcon fill="currentColor" filled />}
+      />
+      <Spacer y={1} />
+      <Button iconRight={<CameraIcon fill="currentColor" />}>
+        Take a photo
+      </Button>
+      <Spacer y={1} />
+      <Button icon={<LockIcon fill="currentColor" />} color="success">
+        Lock
+      </Button>
+      <Spacer y={1} />
+      <Button icon={<NotificationIcon fill="currentColor" />} color="secondary">
+        Notifications
+      </Button>
+      <Spacer y={1} />
+      <Button icon={<UserIcon fill="currentColor" />} color="error" flat>
+        Delete User
+      </Button>
+      <Spacer y={1} />
+      <Button icon={<UserIcon />} disabled>
+        Delete User
+      </Button>
+    </>
+  );
+}`;
+
+const react = {
+  '/HeartIcon.js': HeartIcon,
+  '/CameraIcon.js': CameraIcon,
+  '/LockIcon.js': LockIcon,
+  '/NotificationIcon.js': NotificationIcon,
+  '/UserIcon.js': UserIcon,
+  '/App.js': AppJs
+};
+
+export default {
+  ...react
+};

+const App = `import { Button, Grid, Loading } from "@nextui-org/react";
+
+export default function App() {
+  return (
+    <Grid.Container gap={2}>
+      <Grid>
+        <Button auto clickable={false} color="primary" css={{ px: "$13" }}>
+          <Loading color="white" size="sm" />
+        </Button>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Button auto clickable={false} color="secondary" css={{ px: "$13" }}>
+          <Loading type="spinner" color="white" size="sm" />
+        </Button>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Button auto clickable={false} color="success" css={{ px: "$13" }}>
+          <Loading type="points" color="white" size="sm" />
+        </Button>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Button auto clickable={false} color="warning" css={{ px: "$13" }}>
+          <Loading type="points-opacity" color="white" size="sm" />
+        </Button>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid>
+        <Button auto clickable={false} color="error" css={{ px: "$13" }}>
+          <Loading type="spinner" color="white" size="sm" />
+        </Button>
+      </Grid>
+    </Grid.Container>
+  );
+}`;
+
+const react = {
+  '/App.js': App
+};
+
+export default {
+  ...react
+};

Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context
Removed Extra Spaces

+  return (

+          <Card hoverable clickable>
+            <Card.Body css={{ p: 0 }}>
+              <Card.Image
+                objectFit="cover"
+                src={item.img}
+                width="100%"
+                height={140}
+                alt={item.title}
+              />
+            </Card.Body>
+            <Card.Footer justify="flex-start">
+              <Row wrap="wrap" justify="space-between">
+                <Text b>{item.title}</Text>
+                <Text css={{ color: "$accents4", fontWeight: "$semibold" }}>
+                  {item.price}
+                </Text>
+              </Row>
+            </Card.Footer>
+          </Card>
+        </Grid>
+      ))}
+    </Grid.Container>
+  );
 }
+

Types of changes

 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only

Description, Motivation and Context

New docs code editor based on Sandpack which supports Typescript and Javascript, multiples files tabs and provides a generated Codesandbox link
Bug fixes

@@ -0,0 +1,138 @@ +--- +title: 'Table' +description: 'Tables are used to display tabular data using rows and columns. hey allow users to quickly scan, sort, compare, and take action on large amounts of data.' +url: https://nextui.org/docs/components/table +--- + +# Table + +Tables are used to display tabular data using rows and columns. They allow users to quickly scan, sort, compare, and take action on large amounts of data. +The Table implementation is based on +@react-aria/table + +```jsx +import { Table } from '@nextui-org/react'; +``` + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + +> **Note:** This example performs client side async loading thanks to [@react-stately/async-list](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-stately/useAsyncList.html) hook, you can also create a custom implementation of it to fetch the data asynchronously. + + + +> **Note**: This example performs client side sorting by passing **load** and **sort** functions to the [@react-stately/async-list](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-stately/useAsyncList.html) hook and by comparing the data using [@react-aria/i18n](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-aria/useCollator.html) **useCollector** hook. See the docs for more information on how to perform server side sorting. + + + +> **Note**: Its important to have a unique key for each row, otherwise the disabled keys will not work. + + + +> **Note**: Its important to have a unique key for each row, otherwise the default selected keys will not work. + +

nodes.title: MERGING NEW CODE EDITOR
nodes.bodyText:
[LEVEL]/[COMPONENT]
TASK: MERGING NEW CODE EDITOR
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context
*Moved Component Docs to New Editor
*svg files now bundles with code when opening in live editor
*User Doc Added
*Image Doc Added
Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: User Component - Fixed Zoomed and Pointer Property

+const HeartIcon = `import { React } from '@nextui-org/react';\n
+
+export const HeartIcon = ({
+  fill = 'currentColor',
+  filled,
+  size,
+  height,
+  width,
+  label,
+  ...props
+}) => {
+  return (
+    <svg
+      width={size || width || 24}
+      height={size || height || 24}
+      viewBox="0 0 24 24"
+      fill={filled ? fill : 'none'}
+      xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
+      {...props}

+const App = `import { Card,Grid,Row,Text } from '@nextui-org/react';
+    
+export default function App() {
+  const list = [
+    {
+      title: 'Orange',
+      img: '/images/fruit-1.jpeg',
+      price: '$5.50'
+    },
+    {
+      title: 'Tangerine',
+      img: '/images/fruit-2.jpeg',
+      price: '$3.00'
+    },
+    {
+      title: 'Raspberry',
+      img: '/images/fruit-3.jpeg',
+      price: '$10.00'
+    },
+    {
+      title: 'Lemon',
+      img: '/images/fruit-4.jpeg',
+      price: '$5.30'
+    },
+    {
+      title: 'Advocato',
+      img: '/images/fruit-5.jpeg',
+      price: '$15.70'
+    },
+    {
+      title: 'Lemon 2',
+      img: '/images/fruit-6.jpeg',
+      price: '$8.00'
+    },
+    {
+      title: 'Banana',
+      img: '/images/fruit-7.jpeg',
+      price: '$7.50'
+    },
+    {
+      title: 'Watermelon',
+      img: '/images/fruit-8.jpeg',
+      price: '$12.20'
+    }
+];
+
+  return <Grid.Container gap={2} justify="flex-start">
+  {list.map((item, index) => (
+    <Grid xs={6} sm={3} key={index}>
+      <Card hoverable clickable>
+        <Card.Body css={{ p: 0 }}>
+          <Card.Image
+            objectFit="cover"
+            src={item.img}
+            width='100%'
+            height={140}
+            alt={item.title}
+          />
+        </Card.Body>
+        <Card.Footer justify="flex-start">
+          <Row wrap='wrap' justify="space-between">
+            <Text b>
+              {item.title}
+            </Text>
+            <Text css={{ color: "$accents4", fontWeight: "$semibold" }}>
+              {item.price}
+            </Text>
+          </Row>
+        </Card.Footer>
+      </Card>
+    </Grid>
+  ))}
+</Grid.Container>
+}
+`;
+
+const react = {
+  '/App.js': App
+};
+
+export default {
+  ...react
+};

nodes.title: fixed Input "required" parameter forwarding
nodes.bodyText:
[LEVEL]/[COMPONENT]
TASK: 
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context



When using "required" parameter in Input component, it was not being forwarded to actual HTML input.
Screenshots - Animations

nodes.title: docs: `type` is required and fix invalid JavaScript
nodes.bodyText:
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context
The type field is required in the latest version of createTheme. Also, this code snippet is missing a comma and is invalid JavaScript.

commit.message:
docs: `type` is required and fix invalid JavaScript

The `type` field is required in the latest version of NextUI. Also, this code snippet is missing a comma and is invalid JavaScript.

nodes.title: Make `Pagination` properly controlled.
nodes.bodyText:
[LEVEL]/[COMPONENT]
TASK: Fix #324
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context



it seems that the page prop is only used in a useState in the old version, which means the change of this prop will merely affect the render of the Pagination at the first time.
Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: fix #324:  use a better way to fix this problem
add an useEffect to sync between page and activePage

nodes.body:
Thanks for your review. I think it is necessary to add a `useEffect` to set `activePage` when the `page` changes. 

But I think the `setActivePage(page ?? newPage);`  is also useful. 

For instance, if a user clicks the next button in a controlled `Pagination`, without this statement, the `activePage` will differ from the `page`. The expected way is to keep `page` and `activePage` synchronization and notify the `newPage` value using `onChange`, the parent component should provide an `onChange` callback that takes care of the state updating. Once the upper state is updated, the `useEffect` will  update the `activePage` to the `newPage`

Hey @CNLHC thank you for helping the project, I understand your point but the `activePage` won't defer from the `page` because `next` and `previous` methods use the `activePage` (which is synchronized in the `useEffect` with the `page` value) for changing the current page, so if the user wants to update its `page` has to listen to `onChange(newPage)` event, to sum up since the `useEffect` is updating the `activePage` when `page` changes, is not necessary to change it again in the `onChangeActivePage` method,

It should be just

```
 setActivePage(newPage);
```
Thanks for your explanation. You are right.

nodes.title: update ISSUE_TEMPLATE folder files
nodes.bodyText:
What is the change?

add bug_report.md to bug-report.yml to enable Github's form based issue template

https://youtu.be/qQE1BUkf2-s?t=23


add config.yml file to help direct users to the helpful pages
add feature_request.yml


I consolidated the improve-and-existing-component.md and propose-a-new-component.md into this file. I mentioned inside this file that you can suggest improvement to an existing component or propose a new one

Motivation

encourage's bug reporter's to put more care into their bug report before submission
this may help maintainer's receive more detailed & higher quality bug report's
adds helpful tips for user's during the process of creating a bug/issue report

Demo of Change

bug_report.yml file
feature-request.yml file
config.yml file

Types of changes

 Documentation Only

nodes.body:
@jrgarciadev  
Feel free to make edit to my Github branch, github now has Codespaces enabled for nearly all repos on Github.com 🎉  
So you don't even need to run my code on your local computer since Codespaces allows you to edit in the browser now



My fork of nextui: https://github.com/cliffordfajardo/nextui

![CleanShot 2022-02-28 at 13 20 42@2x](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6743796/156060573-d9a1186a-1de8-4091-9939-9f06dbaf1bdc.png)

Hi @Dhananjay-JSR - thank your for the valuable PR feedback. I learned quite a bit of the new features thanks to your suggesstions.

Changes made:
- added Code of Conduct
- fixed typos
- added field for selecting browser from dropdown list


### Follow Up Question from your original pull request feedback
I'm a bit reluctant to make the hyper links shorter for the some of the links inside the description labels since Github renders those very small & its easy to miss those links

![CleanShot 2022-03-01 at 09 11 36@2x](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6743796/156216010-4867d4d8-37b5-4f1c-9078-064ab752c519.png)



I believe one benefit of having the long URL (in places that is easier to miss) is that its much harder for people to miss the useful links in this context. Typically a user might be feeling rushed or frustrated when submitting a bug report or pull request and they might glance over the details.

The long explicit urls helps reduce friction for maintainers and make resources/tips for contributors a bit more easily accessible (hard to miss)

@jrgarciadev - any thoughts?


Not that this matters too much (view it more as a data point), other repos like solidJS and react-query also have the longer explicit URLs
- [react-query bug_report.yml](https://github.com/tannerlinsley/react-query/blob/master/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.yml) file

- [solidjs bug_report.yml](https://github.com/solidjs/solid/blob/main/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.yml) file



Note:
@jrgarciadev - please feel free to make changes on my branch "allow edits from maintainers" is enabled ✅ 

Github codespace link: https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/pull/318#issuecomment-1054675514
Hey, @cliffordfajardo this looks amazing, thank you so much, just one thing, could you please remove the line that says `Code of conduct`?

nodes.bodyText: Hi @cliffordfajardo ! Thank you so much for being willing to contribute 😊Would you be open to updating your PR with the changes described ?

nodes.body:
Updated -
I came back to look at this comment a few hours after you had initially mentioned removing the "code of conduct" section in the form 

it took me a good minute or two to figure out you were referring to the code of conduct; 
I wish Github's code comment feature gave additional context. 

A tip I have for the future is:
specifically mention the exact line or feature because Github's code comment does't give enough context 😄 🙏 

![CleanShot 2022-03-01 at 17 50 29@2x](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6743796/156279700-ee8208ba-0ecb-4097-b65a-3bbad1bbf951.png)

nodes.title: fix: changeTheme function to avoid empty strings
nodes.bodyText:
[LEVEL]/[COMPONENT]
TASK: 308
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context

I added an extra condition to avoid empty strings in this case the next map wouldn't add the semicolon when string is empty.

It avoid to add unnecessary semicolons in document style tag.

Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: fix changeTheme function to avoid empty strings

+This is a [Vite React TypeScript](https://reactjs.org/) project bootstrapped with [`create vite`](https://stackblitz.com/edit/vitejs-vite-9rgerc?file=index.html&terminal=dev).
+
+## Getting Started
+
+First, run the development server:
+
+```bash
+npm install
+npm run dev
+```
+
+Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) with your browser to see the result.
+
+You can start editing the page by modifying `src/App.tsx`. The page auto-updates as you edit the file.
+
+
+
+## Learn More
+
+To learn more about React.js, take a look at the following resources:
+
+- [React.js Documentation](https://reactjs.org/docs/getting-started.html) - learn about React.js features and API.
+- [Learn Vite](https://vitejs.dev/guide/) - Next Generation Frontend Tooling.
+- [Learn Next UI](https://nextui.org/) - Beautiful, fast and modern React UI library.
+
+You can check out [the Next UI GitHub repository](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui) - your feedback and contributions are welcome!
+
+## Creating Production Build
+
+Run
+
+```bash
+npm run build
+```
+
+To Serve the Production App Locally 
+
+```bash
+npm install -g serve
+serve -s dist
+```
